process.description: A process represents a request from one or more clients, usually including an appointment. Compared to an appointment, the process has additional information about the status of the request from the client.

customTextfield.description: additional information for this process from the client

finishTime.description: unix timestamp og time when process has been finished

createTimestamp.description: unix timestamp representing creation of the process

id.description: Number is used to identify appointments like on call displays

lastChange.description: unix timestamp of the last change on this process

status.description:
Status of the process. The following values are possible:
  * free: open for reservation
  * reserved: for updating data, no validation yet
  * confirmed: appointment
  * queued: confirmed and in waiting queue
  * called: show on call displays
  * processing: client appeared and gets service
  * pending: client has to return to fetch papers
  * pickup: client is called to fetch papers
  * finished: successfully processed
  * missed: no client appeared
  * archived: only used in statistics
  * deleted: blocking appointment time
  * anonymized: for statistically purposes only
  * blocked: to avoid the reuse of IDs on the same day
  * conflict: mark process as conflict for check functions

appointmentsOnly.description: true if only appointments should be shown in queue

scope.description: A scope is the central unit for processing requests for clients. It is usally a building or a special location offering workstations to serve the clients. According to the availabilities a scope has, appointments are possible. With a calldisplay and a ticketprinter it can serve clients without an appointment.
